lines.text: Anyone who could swallow two Snowballs and a Ding Dong shouldn't have any trouble with pride.
The 70s are dead and gone. The 80s are going to be something wonderfully new and different, and so am I.
Housework is like bad sex. Every time I do it I swear I will never do it again. Until the next time company comes.
Tacky.
Ron, dear, didn't Greenwich-Village-people-types go out with the '60s?
Village People.
Well, that's not a bad idea, uh, that's what we are.
That's where we're from.
Village People? That's fantastic! Thank you!
Oh, well, it does have a certain charm.
Village People; I can sell that.
How could you just up and quit your job like that?
The Village People.

Ya see, sir, my father is Jewish and my mom, she's Italian Catholic, so, got all the bases covered. Speaking of bases, when the other kids were following the baseball charts I was following the pop charts...
I think I've heard that before. Why don't you save that for the liner notes on the album.
Album? Are we getting an album deal?
No! I did not say that.
Corporate thinking sucks.
Oh, the Indian is hot. I go for exotic types, especially when they're half-naked.
Lulu!
You tell him I'll make up for all the indignities they suffered in "Roots."
Oh, Jackie, it's true. There is magic in the world.
I adore San Francisco! My favorite ex-husband lives there.
Leathermen don't get nervous!
Hey Felipe, how are you feeling?
C... C minus.
What's the matter?
I had to leave my feathers to be oiled. They gave me this one to wear, and it doesn't even fit right.
You think you've got problems? Jack needs some voices on his demo tape for tonight and I need some professional singers who will work for what I can afford to pay.
Professional and for free? That you ain't gonna find.
I'm from the Bronx. My name's Glenn Hughes.
What do you do, Glenn?
I'm a toll collector at the Brooklyn Battery Tunnel.
Do all toll collectors look like that?
Just the hot ones.
Are you really serious about singing?
Fanantical. Fame, fortune, platinum records... it's every boy's dream.

Alexander, you're so shy that people just forget. Listen, you've got to come out of your shell or you'll be leading that singing group in Washington Square for the rest of your life and everything else will just pass you by.
That's why I took a job as a stagehand in a local theater.
That's your first strategic career mistake.

[angry tone]
Hi, I'm Ron White. Your sister sent you a cake. You're not gonna belive this, but a little old lady just robbed me!
Could you run that by me again?
A little old lady armed with a big gun held me up!
No kidding. So, how do you know my sister?
I live next door to her in St. Louis. God, she must have been 80 years old!
Oh that's not my sister. She's older than I am, but not that old.
I'm talking about the old lady who robbed me! She got my wallet, my watch, my class ring. She even got my Phi Beta Kappa key!
Well, it's a good thing she didn't get the cake. I forgot to order desert.
Are you really a policeman?
You don't know Black Irish when you see it?
I should have know that you could sing. But when you see someone everyday, you just don't know what they have. I mean, counting out exercise is sort of singing, right?
Yeah, I think it is. It's sort of like...
[singing]
Got the back bone connected to the hip bone, and the hip bone connected to the thigh bone, and the thigh bone connected to the leg bone
[normal voice]
How's that? Is that a star or is that a star?
Bing! Tonight it is. Be at my place at eight o'clock. You bring the voice, and I'll bring the food... and the wine.
You always were a great hostess, Sam.
Don't be fresh.
Merde!
What?
I dropped my contact lens in the lasagna!
[checking her eyes]
Was it mustard or relish? It was mustard. Lulu, be a darling, stick your finger in there and see if you can find it.
Be original, leave it in. Call it lasagna crunch!

[chewing lasagna containing Samantha's missing contact lens]
So crunchy!
Nice ta meetcha' Miss Edwards...
Simpson...
I've seen ya plastered all over New York, ya know?
Well, don't spread it around.
They must get married in California! they have that marvelous community property here!
I had no idea this was happening! Something told me, go, be with Jackie tonight, and my god! It's a show business first!
Mother!
Mother?
THAT's your mother?
God, she looks better than i do.
I worked with David Merrick... on Broadway. I know about contracts.
My time is now!
I didn't invent it. I'm just in it.
I didn't invent it. I'm just in it.
